title: Check service ID of transaction before accepting to mempool [ECR-3816]
body:
**New changes:**

- Many consensus-related methods of `NodeHandler` are made private.
- Consensus rules are now forbid adding transactions for which `BlockchainMut::check_tx` failed to the block. In particular, that means the following:
  1. Invalid transaction hashes are stored into temporary in-memory set for node to be able to lookup for it without storing it in the persistent memory.
  2. If block propose contains transaction known as invalid, node won't send prevote for it.
  3. If majority of the nodes will decide to approve the block with transaction known as invalid, node will panic (because it's either node implementation bug, or majority of nodes work incorrectly).
  4. If node lagging behind receives a committed block with the incorrect transaction, it panics as well.
- Sandbox tests are added to cover cases 3 and 4 from the list above.

-----

This PR introduces a quasi-new method `check_tx`, which performs some checks on tx before accepting it to the mempool.

Currently, the only check there is correctness of the destination, but later it (hopefully) will be extended with more mature validation.

Since we sort-of had this functionality in 0.12, I guess changelog shouldn't be updated here.

title: Make DispatcherSchema merkelized again [ECR-3810]
body:
It seems that business logic in dispatcher became very complex because there is a two different ways to deploy artifacts and start services.

* During the normal block execution.
* During the execution of genesis block.

We have to eliminate special case for genesis block to make code simpler.

title: Update changelog [ECR-3516]
body:
Hooray, I guess?

Once this gets merged, feel free to turn on your "please-update-a-changelog"-o-meter.

[A link to the rendered version of `CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/popzxc/exonum/blob/update-changelog/CHANGELOG.md)

This update schema:
- This is not a complete migration guide / documentation. Only a short description was added with links to the docs/examples.
- Missing changelog entries for non-dymanic-services changes were added.
- For dynamic services, a four-level description is given:
  1. A short overview.
  2. A short migration guide (not really a guide, more of "where you can find the info" section).
  3. A list of important PRs within implementing the feature.
  4. A list of ALL PRs related to this feature. "Garbage" PRs (e.g. "merge master") are filtered out. However, PRs from `3` are included.
- __Important:__ Inserted links are adapted for the release. They refer to the 0.13 release artifacts, so they don't work now, but will become correct on the release.

title: Harsher naming restrictions in MerkleDB APIs [ECR-3834]
body: Deny using dot in prefixes and service names.

title: Remove max-builtin-id constant [ECR-3851]
body:
**Update:** As @slowli suggested, entry with max builtin instance id was removed and instead public access to the running service list was gained in the Dispatcher.

To ensure that method with `pub` visibility won't leak a mutable access to the dispatcher schema, this method exists only for `ReadonlyFork<'_>` specialization.

---

This PR removes `MAX_BUILTIN_INSTANCE_ID`, introducing the following approach:
- During initialization, `Dispatcher` checks builtin IDs, finding the highest one, and storing it in the entry.
- Within the first dynamic service start, `Supervisor` checks that entry of `Dispatcher`, and assigns the ID as the next to the max builtin ID, initializing its own entry `vacant_instance_id`.
- Since that, IDs are assigned sequentially using `vacant_instance_id` entry.

Such an approach supports sparse builtin instance ID spaces, which may be helpful, i.e., when user has three builtin instances with IDs 0, 1 and 2, but then decides to remove instance with ID 1 from code -- nothing will break then.

title: Remove isolate method [ECR-3820]
body:
We either apply the config with all the changes, or don't apply it at all.
So the `isolate` method is not required anymore.

Slippery moments:
- We still have to panic to rollback changes (will be fixed once we'll be able to return an error in `before_commit`).
- If panic/error occurs during config applying, the proposal is not removed (well, in fact it's removed but then rolled back). However I've added a check in the config proposal tx for it, so it's not a big problem I guess.

title: Restore warn(missing_docs) in the Exonum crate [ECR-3821]
Supervisor modes [ECR-3794] [ECR-3771]
body:
## Description

This PR modifies the `Supervisor` entity such that it's now able to work in either `Simple` or `Decentralized` mode.

The difference between these modes is in the decision-making algorithm:
- Within simple mode, the amount of checks performed by the Supervisor
  is reduced to the minimum: the only requirement is that every request is sent
  by the validator.
- Within decentralized mode, policy on requests is the following:
  deploy requests should be signed and sent by every validator,
  config proposals should be approved by at least (2/3+1) validators.

New "Mode" mechanism is pretty flexible, it allows us to implement different supervisor quite easily if needed (for example, supervisor that don't require deploy request to be sent to every validator, but requires a byzantine quorum for configs).

`Simple` mode is chosen as default one, thus allowing to deploy&init services with a simpler workflow (no more need to send requests to every validator).

## Also

Also, this PR introduces the following changes:
- Allows generic structs to derive `ServiceFactory`.
- `SimpleSupervisor` is removed since it's not needed anymore.
- Tests for `SimpleSupervisor` that duplicate already implemented tests for `Supervisor` are removed. Only tests for simple mode related logic are kept.
- `StartService` is merged into `ConfigPropose` transaction (which means that for `Decentralized` mode byzantine quorum is used).
- `deadline_height` is removed from `StartService`, since it's a part of `ConfigPropose` which contains `actual_from`.
- `actual_from` field is now optional: if it's set to 0, it'll be considered a next height (it's especially useful for simple mode, since we don't anymore have to deduce applicable height).
- `ConfigPropose` now contains `configuration_number` field to avoid conflicting configuration changes based on the same original config.
- A new private endpoint `configuration-number` is introduced, allowing us to get amount of the processed configurations.

title: Update websocket requirement from 0.23 to 0.24
body:
Updates the requirements on [websocket](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket) to permit the latest version.
Commits - [`d516fba`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/d516fba499ce55c5869ab39abc14156001dab637) Try fixing the build - [`a14c7ef`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/a14c7ef78f01c8d211ad75dcd4f69c3499e5a660) Bump version in README - [`a197d5f`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/a197d5ffd43a586dcbe080c2c454abc465d2d1d5) Re-pin nightly version for tests, no clippy for now - [`80313df`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/80313df6bda43c68c754eef2542b54c9ab18f01c) cargo fmt - [`e1b811c`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/e1b811cd4eb5871dfdfc06ec4de9fe61e30d6c3b) Bump version to 0.24.0 - [`0b51f58`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/0b51f5866ca7ec48dba3821e840a7c6f492b99df) Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into split_in_two - [`b3e3970`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/b3e39709497e69812e71a15d40991f9698c75134) Elaborate comment in websocket-base - [`10dbb8c`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/10dbb8c82ffc7e98850dced99a8a97c0b1aa6280) Rename websocket-lowlevel to websocket-base - [`d6f715e`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/d6f715ed89bc5935ed4bbeebf8163a908f0c6bcb) Additional comment - [`9e98df3`](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/commit/9e98df32df02e27392c9e093fcd1f6883c5c8154) Merge pull request [#244](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/issues/244) from najamelan/async_client_example/dont_close_twice - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/websockets-rs/rust-websocket/compare/v0.23.0...v0.24.0)

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com): - Update frequency (including time of day and day of week) - Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time) - Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies) - Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired) - Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)

title: ProofMapIndex variants for hashed and raw keys [ECR-3777]
body:
New variant of the `ProofMapIndex` have been introduced - `RawProofMapIndex`. It is used for keys that maps directly to `ProofPath`, for example `Hash` and  `PublicKey`. By default `ProofMapIndex` is used for keys that implements `ObjectsHash`.
Also removed `ObjectHash` implementation for [u8; 32].

title: Make protobuf artifacts implementation detail of Rust runtime [ECR-3776]
Update smallvec requirement from 0.6 to 1.0
body:
Updates the requirements on [smallvec](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec) to permit the latest version.
Release notes *Sourced from [smallvec's releases](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/releases).* > ## v1.0.0 > * Requires Rust 1.36 or later. > * [breaking change] Use `MaybeUninit` to avoid possible undefined behavior ([#162](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/162), [#170](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/170)). > * [breaking change] The `drain` method now takes a range argument, just like the standard `Vec::drain` ([#145](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/145)). > * [breaking change] Remove the `unreachable` function and replace it with the new standard `unreachable_unchecked` function ([#164](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/164)). > * [breaking change] Use `no_std` by default. This crate depends only on `core` and `alloc` by default. If the optional `write` feature is enabled then it depends on `std` so that `SmallVec<[u8;_]>` can implement the `std::io::Write` trait ([#173](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/173)). > * [breaking change] Remove the deprecated `VecLike` trait ([#165](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/165)). > * Add support for 96-element small vectors, `SmallVec<[T; 96]>` ([#163](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/163)). > * Iterators now implement `FusedIterator` ([#172](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/172)). > * Indexing now uses the standard `SliceIndex` trait ([#166](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/166)). > * Add automatic fuzz testing and MIRI testing ([#168](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/168), [#162](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/162)). > * Update syntax and formatting to Rust 2018 standard ([#174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/174), [#167](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/167)). >
Commits - [`34c2628`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/34c26282c41548b3bd3749b7f4bc38c4fd1f4cfb) Auto merge of [#175](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/175) - mbrubeck:one, r=jdm - [`523a6dc`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/523a6dc9193e5d21d134a20df0ce1964888ed79f) Version 1.0.0 - [`a2c0504`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/a2c0504511850c3fe61897da3e4c318a6600ade9) Auto merge of [#174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/174) - mbrubeck:2018, r=jdm - [`a51059c`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/a51059cd387cb583adb36003bed006d1f2e2c183) Update to Rust 2018 edition - [`01917a6`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/01917a6b1c5d0074fc19acfef48bb64863c458fb) Auto merge of [#168](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/168) - dpc:fuzz, r=mbrubeck - [`a3ba738`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/a3ba738ce66f09915c149b87acd0595aa06ebc83) Add a fake stub input case for afl fuzzer - [`85c54a5`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/85c54a568998018291ceb249d328259e34fc0ea2) Add simple fuzzing - [`b2c9c65`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/b2c9c65129bbc4599899a0516c333bc8eee38da5) Auto merge of [#173](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/173) - mbrubeck:std, r=emilio - [`fffb185`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/fffb185d4f875cd52ce8b89c3406c47986761319) Use no_std by default - [`af73fbd`](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/commit/af73fbdc27daeac1778a8c1eebee8c58638b7af6) Auto merge of [#172](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/servo/rust-smallvec/issues/172) - mbrubeck:fused, r=mbrubeck - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/servo/rust-smallvec/compare/v0.6.0...v1.0.0)

title: Differentiated access to database [ECR-3760] [ECR-3768] [ECR-3769]
body:
## Overview

This PR introduces read-only access to forks, differentiates read-only and full access to indexes, and maps these changes to the blockchain access API.

### Bikeshedding targets

- Names of methods, e.g., in `merkledb::AccessExt` (`list` or `get_list`? `ensure_map` or `get_or_create_map` or something else entirely?) and `BlockchainData`.
- Whether `AccessExt` makes sense in general (vs having public index constructors).
- Whether it was a correct decision to remove references to indexes and `ObjectAccess`.
- Lazy vs eager creation of indexes in schemas, its impact on performance and UX.

### More important stuff

- How much does this break EJB?

### Definition of Done

- [ ] There are no TODOs left in the merged code
- [ ] Change is covered by automated tests
- [ ] Benchmark results are attached (if applicable)
- [ ] The [coding guidelines] are followed
- [ ] Public API has proper documentation
- [ ] Changelog is updated if needed (in case of notable or breaking changes)
- [ ] The continuous integration build passes

[coding guidelines]: https://github.com/exonum/exonum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#conventions

title: Remove ApiContext structure [ECR-3745]
body:
## Overview

This method removes `ApiContext` structure and replaces its usage with `Blockchain`, since their layout became the same.

**Also**, this PR reduces the visibility of the `Blockchain::into_mut` method, since it's not really clear that this method should be called only once, and it's easy to misuse it (e.g. one can try to obtain the `Fork` with that method, which is completely incorrect).
However, that doesn't affect the public interface, since this method is just a sugar for (also public) `BlockchainBuilder`.

title: Implement ObjectHash for SignedMessage
body:
## Overview

Implement `hash(SignedMessage) = hash(payload || key.bytes || sign.bytes)` as specified in `consensus.proto`.

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the merged code
- [x] The continuous integration build passes

title: SimpleSupervisor: Verify that config proposal is sent by validator [ECR-3742]
body:
## Overview

This PR enhances the `SimpleSupervisor` with check for proposal author to be a validator (as in `Supervisor`). For node administrator workflow is not the same as for `Supervisor`: request with config proposal should be sent through private API endpoint.

However, this is the only check performed, there is no need to send request by all validators, and there is no need to send confirmations as well.

title: Integration test python lib
body:
This PR provides a library for writing integration tests for Exonum, and two examples of usage (one based on `exonum-python-client` and one based on `exonum-launcher`).

What's in the scope of this PR:
- Providing a handy interface for writing integration tests.
- Providing several examples to simplify library learning.

What's out of the scope of this PR:
- Adding integration tests to the CI.
- Creating a comprehensive integration test set.
- Publishing library to the `pypi`.
- Creating documentation.

title: Introduce test-suite directory
body:
## Overview

This PR introduces a new directory "test_suite" which (already) contains `testkit` and (will) contain all the integration tests later (starting from python).

title: Make dispatcher mostly syncrhonous
body:
As inspired by discussion in #1500, I've attempted to made a fully synchronous version of the dispatcher (i.e., one that does not process service starts, artifact deploys, etc. out of band).

Highlights:

- Making the dispatcher synchronous is achieved by encapsulating runtimes into reference-counted pointers. Since a dispatcher instance is encapsulated within a `Blockchain`, this means using `Arc<_>`, which in turn led to some additional `Sync` constraints (e.g., for `Runtime`) and, correspondingly, more complex data types. This shouldn't impact performance *too* much, since the access to the guarded vars is uncontested; but I didn't check the performance impact.
- I believe that it is possible (and desirable) to remove `Dispatcher` from `Blockchain`; `Blockchain` should be a cloneable pointer to shared blockchain resources (e.g., DB), while `Dispatcher`, like `Fork`s, should reside in a single consensus thread. This is currently blocked by `Dispatcher` being used to generate HTTP APIs for the services. I believe that it makes sense to make the HTTP API the implementation detail of the Rust runtime and inject service endpoints into it.
- Contexts for transaction execution and `before_commit` hook are now expressed with a single type, which also implements "child call" functionality. On creating a child context, we check that the `instance_id` we attempt to call exists, and return an error otherwise. I believe we can (and should) check the interface implementation likewise, but I didn't implement this so far.
- Config changes and `Configure` interface are fully moved out from the core crate into the supervisor crate. Dispatcher schema is not (yet) removed, but this looks like the primary target for further work.

body:

Attempt to optimize sharing Exonum protobuf specification with external clients according to the discussion in corresponding ticket.
- .proto files updated with Java specific package (does not afect non-Java builds)
- Added script for sharing public info of specification to a specific repo.

**UPD:**
As discussed:
- the proto files synchronization script has been moved to the `exonum-proto-sources` repo
- the `java_package` option has been changed from `com.exonum.binding.messages` to `com.exonum.core.messages` for all shared proto files.

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot badge me` will comment on this PR with code to add a "Dependabot enabled" badge to your readme Additionally, you can set the following in your Dependabot [dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com): - Update frequency (including time of day and day of week) - Pull request limits (per update run and/or open at any time) - Automerge options (never/patch/minor, and dev/runtime dependencies) - Out-of-range updates (receive only lockfile updates, if desired) - Security updates (receive only security updates, if desired)

title: Extract keys module into a separate crate
body: Since we agreed that demonolithization is one of the goals that we should achieve, I decided to make a small step in that direction.

title: Move proto to separate crate.
body:
This PR's purpose is to extract `ProtobufConvert` trait to separate module.
It makes possible to implement protobuf serialization for several types in their own crates.
For examples protobuf serialization for crypto types is now implemented in `exonum-crypto` crate.

**Note:** `ProtobufConvert` derive will be extracted in the following PR.

title: Enhancements in Testkit
body:
## Overview

<!-- Please describe your changes here 
  and list any open questions you might have. -->
- Rust runtime is considered default and always created while creating Testkit. Other runtimes considered additional and can be added via builder's method `.with_additional_runtime()`.
- Added checking for runtimes duplicates in the builder.
- Various enhancements: refactoring, methods naming, an additional method for adding `SimpleSupervisor` to the builder.
---
<!-- This is for Exonum Team members only. -->

title: Do start and initialize service at single step [ECR-3222]
Fix supervisor creation
body:
It turned out that I have broken supervisor creation in the #1473

Shame on me: I knew about it, but forgot to add a fix.

Indirectly it means that we are very good at nitpicking our pull requests, but nevertheless can approve a PR with some big issues not fixed yet `¯\_(ツ)_/¯`

title: Avoid waiting in the `add_transaction` endpoint [ECR-3222]
body: This change may improve liveness on highload.

title: Add support of external runtimes to exonum-cli
body: Currently we aren't able to create a node with additional runtimes with `exonum-cli`.

title: Set address name in index_metadata [ECR-3578]
body:
Somehow it turned out that provided index address name was lost on the `index_metadata` call step.

This PR fixes it and adds a test so it won't happen anymore.

title: Improve support for additional runtimes in TestKit [ECR-3444]
body:
## Overview

Rust runtime is considered builtin (and always included into the testing blockchain) and any other runtime - additional. Additional runtimes should be created via factories. Also, factories re-create runtimes through testkit's restart.

---

title: Extract supervisor service from core
body:
...and return where it belongs to.

Quick summary:

- `exonum-supervisor` is now a separate crate in the `services` directory.
- `blockchain` does not insert `exonum-supervisor` into services list.
- ...and `exonum-cli` does.
- `testkit` is adapted according to the changes above.
- `supervisor` tests from `testkit` are moved to the `exonum-supervisor` crate.
